intro: Chrysanthoglossum trifurcatum, commonly known as the three-lobed chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, with three distinct lobes on each petal, giving it a unique and striking appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
